title: Formation of ISRO
description: ISRO (Indian Space Research Organization) was officially established, with the vision to harness space technology for national development.

title: Aryabhata — First Indian Satellite
description: India’s first satellite, Aryabhata, was launched, marking the country’s entry into space.

title: Rohini (RS-1) via SLV-3
description: India placed Rohini RS-1 into orbit using the indigenous SLV-3, proving launch capability.

title: PSLV-D2 Success
description: PSLV achieved a key success, becoming ISRO’s workhorse launcher for diverse missions.

title: Chandrayaan-1
description: ISRO launched Chandrayaan-1, which made a major discovery: water molecules on the lunar surface.

title: Mars Orbiter Mission (Mangalyaan)
description: India became the first Asian nation to reach Mars orbit — and the first in the world to do it in the first attempt.

title: PSLV-C37 — 104 Satellites
description: A single PSLV mission deployed 104 satellites, demonstrating precise rideshare capability.

title: Chandrayaan-3 — South Pole Landing
description: India became the first country to land near the Moon's south pole, showcasing ISRO's growing technological edge in planetary exploration.
